definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The employment of a lot number from which the complete batch history can be determined.
sentences.chinese: 批號的使用，倨其完整的批歷史可以確定。

sentences.english: The breakdown of 82B rod stock has been evaluated and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 對某些批號的82B盤條斷裂進行了檢驗分析。

sentences.english: The batch number should be marked clearly on every container.
sentences.chinese: 每個容器上的批號須清楚標明。

sentences.english: Results The dissolution parameters of Huanglianshangqing Tablets of different batch number showed significant difference.
sentences.chinese: 結果不同批號樣品間的溶出度有顯著性差異。

sentences.english: Batch 206 and greater are okay, and should not be aborted.
sentences.chinese: 批號206以及之後的任務都是正常的，不需要中止。

sentences.english: If one isn't printed, e-mail the batch number to the company.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能打印，電子郵件批號的公司。

sentences.english: End-sealing nip have steel batch number, which can replace according to the date.
sentences.chinese: 封尾夾頭上安裝有鋼模批號，可方便進行更換。

sentences.english: A unique lot number should be assigned to this quantity of material.
sentences.chinese: 單一的批號，應分配給合乎質量的物料。

definition: to brew/to make (wine, vinegar, soybean paste etc) by fermentation
to leave the factory (of finished goods)
to sell/to sell on commission/to distribute
